definition: to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
surname Gong
to turn/to go around a corner
to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to stoop
winding road/roundabout route/detour/(fig.) wrong way (of doing sth)
to make a sudden turn
Wan Wan (1981-), Taiwanese blogger and cartoonist
Wan Wan (1981-), Taiwanese blogger and cartoonist
to take an indirect route/to waste one's time by using an inappropriate method
(dialect) to take a walk/to go for a stroll
curved/meandering/zigzagging
curved/meandering/zigzagging
crook of the arm
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
erhua variant of 遛彎|遛弯[liu4 wan1]

sentences.english: She bent to touch the leaves of a plant or to smell a flower.
sentences.chinese: 她彎下腰去觸摸植物的葉子或花的氣味。

sentences.english: All drain traps shall be approved type and manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 所有排水裝置及存水彎的類型及生產廠家應經認可。

sentences.english: Gatsby and I in turn leaned down and took the small reluctant hand.
sentences.chinese: 蓋茨比和我先後彎下腰來，握一握不情願的小手。

sentences.english: Appropriately, Maternity Bend follows Hospital Bridge. This too was named after a medical facility – Macau's Maternity Hospital.
sentences.chinese: 山頂醫院天橋之後是產房彎，以澳門的婦產醫院命名。

sentences.english: The elbow may be resolved into straight section and a bend.
sentences.chinese: 將回彎頭分解爲直管段和回彎兩部分。

sentences.english: She stooped to pick a flower.
She reached down, picked up a suitcase, and put it back in the van.
sentences.chinese: 她彎下腰，拎起一個手提箱放回貨車裏。

sentences.english: In motion, they must turn neither in nor out.
sentences.chinese: 運動時，他們既不能向外翻，也不能向內彎。

sentences.english: The messenger bent and scratched at his knee where the strapping chafed.
sentences.chinese: 送信人彎下腰來，撓着膝部被綁腿磨紅的地方。

sentences.english: Hamilton said he lost time in T9 (where Webber crashed) and on the final hairpin he lost whatever advantage he had.
sentences.chinese: 漢密爾頓說在9號彎角和最後一個回頭彎沒有跑好。

sentences.english: When fracture of the wounded lower limbs is secured, limbs wants curved move to show bend ancon unbend to bind.
sentences.chinese: 傷員下肢骨折固定時，肢體要彎着呈屈肘狀伸直捆綁。

sentences.english: Elbows have no tendency to turn in or out when standing or gaiting .
sentences.chinese: 站立時或行走中，肘部沒有向內彎或向外翻的跡象。

sentences.english: The fingers are long and curved which suggest she might have been able to swing through trees.
sentences.chinese: 又長又彎的手指顯示她可能有在樹間穿行的能力。

sentences.english: The old man bent and examined the gangster’s broken face.
sentences.chinese: 老人彎下腰仔細看了看那傢伙被打爛的臉。

sentences.english: Pandu bowed again, this time deeply and reverently. "Now I am truly indebted to you, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 潘杜又再次鞠個躬，這回他可是真的彎下腰來了。

sentences.english: There are no artificial colors of flavors in our Meat Blast Brand Twists.
sentences.chinese: 有沒有在我們的口味高爐品牌彎人造肉的顏色。

definition: to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
slowly/unhurriedly/little by little
this kind of/so/this way/like this/such
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
that kind/that sort
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)
just now/a moment ago
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to erect/vertical/vertical stroke (in Chinese characters)
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
